description: On the shore of Lochaber Lake a small stream exits the hill.  What you don?t know and probably very little people know is that if you follow this brook upstream, you will be rewarded by a series of small but beautiful waterfall in a narrow gorge.I chose to walk up the old woods road or you could probably drive it.  When you see a small pond to your left it?s time to enter the woods.  A very steep but shore slope brings you back to the stream?s edge.  Follow the stream as it flows in a mixed forest with a high canopy.  After only a few minutes you enter the small 30ft high gorge.  The rocks here are very different a mixture of different types.  I saw some limestone rocks with a nice leaf fossil on it.  There are approximately 5 different falls within the small area of the gorge.  The falls were flowing with water in August and I think would be even more spectacular at times of high water
directions: Highway 7 south of Antigonish.  Turn to drive on the West Side Lochaber Road.  The brook flows under this road at 45 24.088N, 62 02.488W
title: Lochaber Gorge
